Brush High School Individual Learning Plans will begin taking place in the next week. All students have been assigned a teacher to help build relationships with students and families so that we can begin having more in depth and personalized conversations about what you want for your student's future and what the school can provide.

Additionally, during this unusual time we will use it as a weekly check in with students and families to maintain a quality line of communication and support. You will begin being contacted by teachers this week as the initial check in.

We look forward to building quality relationships with each student and family, and get through this unusual time so we can return normal operations in the future!

To the Brush Community,

Thank you so much for your love, support and generosity that you have shown to me over these difficult months. It has been humbling and brings tears of joy to my eyes to have such a loving and caring community around me. Because of your support it has made it easier on me to focus on fighting this battle. I hope you know how much I appreciate all of you, how much I love your kids and long to be back in the classroom with them. Thank you to the Brush Secondary School’s High School Student Council, Middle School Student Council, and the High School Band and Choir for the amazing fundraisers you put on in my behalf. You are an amazing group of people and I am so proud to tell everyone where I work. This short letter just skims the surface of what you all mean to me, and what you have done for me. Thank You!

Angela Shaffer

post_text: Class of 2020- We haven’t forgot about you. We will do our best to finish out this year with as many of the iconic senior moments as we can. November 20, 2019 at 9:52 PM ·

Here are the IceBank tanks provided by Calmac Corp. at Brush Beetdiggers (Brush High School and Middle School in Brush, Colorado). These storage tanks mean the chiller can be 40 to 50 percent smaller than other HVAC systems, because the chiller works in conjunction with the IceBank tanks during on-peak daytime hours to manage the building’s cooling load. During off-peak nighttime hours, the chiller charges the IceBank tanks for use during the next day’s cooling. Extending the chiller hours of operation results in the lowest possible average load.
Thanks to our project partners GMCN Architects and Adolfson & Peterson Construction. #transforminglives #enhancingcommunities
